actor_awards.notes: Miranda was the first Latin American to leave her handprints at Grauman's Chinese Theatre. Two of her films, 'The Gang's All Here' and 'Down Argentine Way', have been inducted into the National Film Registry.

filmography.title: The Gang's All Here
filmography.role_description: A fiery Brazilian entertainer who performs the surreal, legendary musical number 'The Lady in the Tutti Frutti Hat' featuring giant bananas.
filmography.plot: A soldier falls for a chorus girl before leaving for war, but complications arise when he returns as a decorated hero with a fiancée back home.
filmography.awards: National Film Registry: Inducted (2014); Oscar: Nominated – Best Art Direction

filmography.title: Down Argentine Way
filmography.role_description: Miranda's American film debut; she appears as a featured performer at a Buenos Aires nightclub, introducing her signature style to US audiences.
filmography.plot: An American heiress travels to Argentina to buy horses and falls in love with a local breeder, despite a long-standing feud between their fathers.
filmography.awards: National Film Registry: Inducted (2014); Oscar: Nominated – Best Cinematography, Best Art Direction, Best Original Song

filmography.title: That Night in Rio
filmography.role_description: The jealous, fiery girlfriend of an American nightclub entertainer who impersonates a Brazilian baron.
filmography.plot: An American entertainer in Rio impersonates a lookalike baron to help him secure a financial deal, confusing both his girlfriend and the baron's wife.

filmography.title: Week-End in Havana
filmography.role_description: A hot-tempered Cuban nightclub singer who becomes suspicious of a steamship executive trying to keep a customer happy.
filmography.plot: When a cruise ship runs aground, an executive must keep a shopgirl happy in Havana to avoid a lawsuit, while dealing with his jealous girlfriend.

filmography.title: Springtime in the Rockies
filmography.role_description: A Brazilian secretary who accompanies her boss to a mountain resort, causing romantic friction with his ex-partner.
filmography.plot: Two bickering dance partners reunite at a resort in the Canadian Rockies, complicating their relationships with their current love interests.

filmography.title: Copacabana
filmography.role_description: A talented singer whose agent (Groucho Marx) books her for two different jobs at the same nightclub, forcing her to play two separate women.
filmography.plot: An agent books his only client for two different singing gigs at the same club, forcing her to assume a dual identity.

filmography.title: A Date with Judy
filmography.role_description: A rumba instructor who is mistakenly believed to be having an affair with the father of the teenage protagonist.
filmography.plot: A teenager misunderstands her father's relationship with a dance instructor, leading to a series of comedic complications before the school dance.

filmography.title: Doll Face
filmography.role_description: A performer in a burlesque show who aids the title character in her quest to write an autobiography and gain respectability.
filmography.plot: A burlesque queen writes her memoirs to gain class and move to Broadway, with the help of her manager and friends.

filmography.title: Greenwich Village
filmography.role_description: A fortune teller and nightclub performer in 1920s New York who helps a classical composer get his music heard.
filmography.plot: A composer from the Midwest moves to Greenwich Village and falls for a singer while trying to sell his concerto.

filmography.title: Something for the Boys
filmography.role_description: A defense plant worker who discovers she can receive radio transmissions through her teeth and helps three cousins renovate a plantation.
filmography.plot: Three cousins inherit a dilapidated southern plantation and turn it into a home for wives of servicemen stationed nearby.

filmography.title: Nancy Goes to Rio
filmography.role_description: A Brazilian actress and confidante who helps a young American actress navigate romance and career misunderstandings in Rio.
filmography.plot: A mother and daughter unwittingly compete for the same role in a musical and the affection of the same man.

filmography.title: Scared Stiff
filmography.role_description: A showgirl on a cruise ship to Cuba who gets mixed up with Dean Martin and Jerry Lewis in a haunted castle mystery.
filmography.plot: A singer and his bumbling busboy friend flee a murder frame-up and end up on a spooky island inherited by an heiress.

filmography.title: Four Jills in a Jeep
filmography.role_description: A cameo appearance as herself performing for the troops in this musical based on the real-life USO experiences of four actresses.
filmography.plot: Four female stars tour Army bases overseas during World War II, entertaining the troops and dealing with romance and hardships.

filmography.title: If I'm Lucky
filmography.role_description: A harpist in a down-on-its-luck band who helps the singer run for governor in this musical comedy.
filmography.plot: A band's singer is recruited to run for governor by corrupt politicians, but he decides to run an honest campaign.

filmography.title: Banana da Terra
filmography.role_description: In her final Brazilian film, Miranda performs the song 'O Que É Que A Baiana Tem?', debuting her signature baiana costume.
filmography.plot: The queen of a fictional banana-producing island is kidnapped and taken to Rio de Janeiro, where she falls in love with a musician.

filmography.title: Alô, Alô, Carnaval
filmography.role_description: Miranda appears alongside her sister Aurora in this musical revue, performing the famous duet 'Cantoras do Rádio'.
filmography.plot: Two authors try to find a sponsor for their musical revue at a casino, leading to a showcase of Brazil's top radio stars.

filmography.title: Estudantes
filmography.role_description: A young radio singer who becomes the object of a student's affection in this early Brazilian musical comedy.
filmography.plot: A university student falls in love with a radio singer, causing complications with his studies and social life.

filmography.title: Alô, Alô, Brasil!
filmography.role_description: A featured singer in this musical revue film that showcased the most popular Brazilian radio artists of the era.
filmography.plot: A man searches for a radio singer he has fallen in love with, amidst a series of musical numbers by Brazil's radio stars.

filmography.title: A Voz do Carnaval
filmography.role_description: Miranda's screen debut in a semi-documentary musical celebrating Rio's carnival.
filmography.plot: A mix of documentary footage and musical performances showcasing the vibrancy of the Rio de Janeiro Carnival.
